page.title: 19CHERRY TREE and MICKLEY HALL
page.content:
they get up at 7.45am. the boys and girls all join in doing all the family jobs. Most children stay at the home for several years because of family problems.
{MICKLEY HALL The Cheshire Home on Mickley Lane occupies the former orphanage.Now the children are cared for at {Cherry {Tree,}next door.Alterations and extentions were made to the old building to house the residents.A new section was opened by the Duchess of Gloucester on 20 March 1985.There are separate rooms for all the 36 residents which are equipped with television,radio and telephone.These are designed to make life as comfortable as possible for people who though suffering from severe physical handicaps,have alert minds.Recent
